reviews.review_msg: Dave is actually very nice. I especially like the "applied" approach to teaching Stats course (he teaches us how to use R). If you ask him a question he is willing to help.
he is actually a nice prof, but the exams were totally different with the assignments, exams are quite tricky
Not that clear.. Have to read the text and study by yourself most of the time, little relation between his lecture and his exam..
Really nice person to talk to! But the exams are supper hard

I'd say Tim teaches well in class. But still, the whole course is a mess. No assignments or homework are left(also Tim said that he hated the textbook) so that you entirely rely on your own lecture notes. Exams are SUPER SUPER HARD especially when you are left no chance to practice. The grading is also all or nothing. Average is around 40%.
tough exam
Nice and her exams are fair, lecture may contain extra difficult content.
Very caring professor.

Professor Hu is amazing! She is very reasonable and respectful professor. The course material itself is challenging. However if you try to understand the concepts in the lectures, its not that bad. Homework questions are not much related to exam questions but her lecture examples are similar to exams. Pay attention to the lectures!

She is incapable of teaching, that's it. Her lecture notes make easy concepts hard to understand. You have to study by yourself, the assignment has nothing to do with the lectures, and lectures shows no examples. She expects you to know everything.

I had nothing but complaints about her as well and I bombed the first midterm even though I was studying hard on my own using the book. But if you focus on the keys points she's saying in lecture, and yes do some additional work on your own, and go to her for help then you'll do fine. She is super helpful! Her exams and marking are extremely fair.

Yes, it is sometimes hard to understand her during lectures but it's definitely not out of this world. The material of the course is naturally challenging but Joan is a professor that truly cares about her students in my experience and is happy to help you out. Her tests are beyond reasonable and are actually not that difficult. I fully recommend.
ABORT! ABORT! Worst professor ever, DONOT take her class, you will regret immediately. Horrible lectures and horrible notes. You may as well skip class and do self study.
She cannot teach; you can try to self-study for her class, but to describe her in one word: HORRIBLE... avoid at all costs

it's hard to understand her English. Basically, her speech has lots of semicolons and if u don't pay full attention, u can't get what she's talking about. Also, her notes are not useful,looks like an outline, usually do not have examples shown on the notes.
throws u lots of stuff and expects u know them. assignments are way harder than what she teaches

Dr Wang is a nice and caring person. Lectures were pretty dry. Make sure you know how to derive formulae -- that was a huge focus in all the exams. The exams were pretty tight on time, with barely enough thinking time. The notes are very organized though, which is a big plus. The textbook is very helpful, as is the TA.

Exams resembled lecture content but barely reflected assignments. Assignments involved computational problems, while most exam questions were proofs. Ensure you can derive everything (not exaggerating). The exams are fair but are difficult to finish on time. The TA and the textbook were essential to my success in the course.
One of the worst prof I had. Her lecture is boring and dry, and she literally just reads her slides during class. Has to teach myself through out the semester.

Liangliang is a good prof. She is kind, patient, ethical and does her best to explain concepts. Sometimes she fails to explain the material clearly or does not provide intuitive explanations. But generally, she is a good teacher. Her midterms are of average difficulty. If you work diligently an A is guaranteed.
She's a great professor who gave us bonus marks for midterm and final exam to bring the average up. Course requirements practice and there's lots of practice questions

Sonja is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. She explains things so clearly and gives a concise breakdown of how to approach and solve problems. Fair warning brush up on your calculus and it will be expect of you, and instructs you clearly on this, to go over some conceptual exercises and derivations on your own time.

DONT TAKE THIS PROF!! Handwrites notes & (sometimes) uploads them, doesnt post or teach from any slides. Exams and hw are not based on what is taught in class, which is hard to follow. Makes sexist comments and criticizes us for not "doing work." Be prepared to self-learn the entire course- content is not actually difficult. Good human, bad teacher
In last minute, informed us final only worth 15%. WORST PROF EVER! Try to avoid him.

Worst prof ever. Didn't show any respect to students. He could make as many as mistakes as he wanted while students were not allowed to make any mistakes. Postponed second midterm for 2 more weeks and didn't give any new lectures during these two weeks. Also, being late very frequently.

do not miss his class, his lecture is clear and he will give hint of which kind of question he will give in midterm,but not final. he is lazy but doent effect anything u dont miss class.a little bit critical on his marking but it is ok

great prof. enjoyed te class of 20. puts great effort to teaching..but sometimes he explains in too much detail that got me confused...made the 2nd mt much easier than the 1st kus of thr low class avg on the 1st..still need to take the final though..
Very clear, but may have skipped some important topics to achieve that? His tests are fair, right out of what he teaches or assigns as homework. Notes can be more organized though.
he is useless, all he does in class is proofs and he never actually explains how or when to use the formulas.  i hated going to his class and would reccomend that people take anybody else but him

took his stat 270 and 285, he got A LOT lazier in 285. no more print out notes, and no more practice exams. promises to post notes online, but never follows through. reduced 7+ assignments to 4 just cuz TA only has 23 hrs to mark hw... he always claims he will give pop quizzes... but by how lazy ive observed him to be, that will never happen.

Fantastic professor, super clear on most of the material, but he is difficult to understand at first (accent + softly spoken) - that's not a big deal though. Exams were incredibly straightforward, slightly easier than homework questions. The text is also solid to read if you're unclear. All I did was understand each homework question and got an A+

As a Chinese professor, his accent is not heavy which you can understand what he is talking about. He likes to skip steps on examples, but if you visit him during the office hour, or ask his TA, you should be okay, as this course is not that difficult as expected.

This man is amazing. His knowledge of statistics is vast and varied. Boxin's teaching style is very clear, but sometimes he likes to omit steps. Nonetheless, his talent is inspiring and his love for the subject has allowed him to so easily teach it. His exams might require some creativity, but are straightforward in many cases. Would recommend
really a good prof. His voice is a lil bit low in lecture but if u ask him for hellp after class or in office hour, he will help you a lot by making those cufused stuff clear to you.
The easiest courses I have ever had
Good prof in general.Easy course and crystal note. But you have to sit in the front of class or you cant hear him say a word!

Sit near the front or you won't be able to hear him. Doesn't allow a formula sheet (and there are a number of them), but the exams were okay. They weren't out of a lot, so not much room for mistakes. Try to memorize formulas for the final. Homework was not bad and infrequent. Easier to understand than stat 270, in my opinion.

Boxin is great. Super good at what he does. He is a genius when it comes to stats. Really fair and straightforward tests. Only thing is, he talks really quietly so he is sometimes hard to understand. Great prof tho.
good,very helpful

My deep respect to this man of knowledge. I was fortunate enough to be almost single attendant of his office hours during the semester that inspired and taught me a lot. His attitude is receptive, phrases are finished, focus is steady, connection with book is clear, exams well announced and predictable. Boris.

He knows his stuff but understanding what he's saying in lectures is hard. His English is heavily accented and he always sounds like he's mumbling. The book is crap because it's focused on applications. Go to his office hrs if u want to learn and suck it up when he accuses u of not going to class.
The worst teacher i ever had..wasting time on handing over the hwk by calling everyone's name...and he doesn't speak english at all...he should goto ESL before coming to lecture....

im sure this guy is really smart, but I dont think he is speaking English.. is he?  Can anyone else understand a word that comes out of his mouth?  Even the translator for the deff boy didnt get it and was writing "inaudible... mumbling...incomprehensible..."  Thank goodness for the ... text book?

She is good at statistics, and she has tried her best to release as much office hour as she can. you don't have to use textbook, her note is really clarity. I do suggest you to take her class, and visit her office hour if you need.
if you come to his class and take notes,you will find it easy to get a high grade.All staff in midterms and final comes from his notes. I got an A in his class.

He does not expecting you to memorize all the proofs. When you really understand it , everything will just be so clear. You trying to memorize everything only because you don't truly  understand it.  Easy A+   Great  Chinese teacher

easy prof, but he makes you feel like it's just a pure memorization test, go to his lecture, copy down all his notes and memorize it, you can guarantee an A (coz he will test you EXACTLY what he wrote during the lecture, like reproduce how to prove a theorem... ). However, if you want to really learn something, avoid him.
his midterms are easy, but final is really hard. Too many things to memorized for final.. And he is unlikely willing to give extra help to his students(especially chinese).
a

clear lectures, friendly, easy midterms, but overly difficult final; asked us to prove every diffificult identify/theorem/equation in the course - the final ended up feeling like a rote memorization test, which was kinda disappointing......
